Back to Joseph Haydn

Joseph Haydn

Sonata in D major, Hob. XVI:5a

before 1766–1767 · Landon 28

[Wikipedia]

Total duration: 8'

  • 1.
  • 2. Menuet – Trio

The Hoboken catalogue originally identified this sonata as the piano part of a divertimento, and numbered it accordingly as XIV:5.

Recommended editions

  • Gesamtausgabe (Henle) · XVIII, 1 · HN 5472 · Klaviersonaten / 1. Folge · ed. Georg Feder
  • Henle · HN 1336 · Sämtliche Klaviersonaten / Band I · ed. Georg Feder [with completion of mov. 1 by Christian Rieger]
  • Henle · HN 1337 · Sämtliche Klaviersonaten / Band I · ed. Georg Feder [with completion of mov. 1 by Christian Rieger]
  • Henle · HN 1536 · Sämtliche Klaviersonaten / Band I · ed. Georg Feder [with completion of mov. 1 by Christian Rieger]
  • Könemann · K 123 · Sonaten III · ed. Miklós Dolinszky [mov. 2]
  • Wiener Urtext · UT 50257 · Sämtliche Klaviersonaten / Band II · ed. Christa Landon / Ulrich Leisinger [with completion of mov. 1 by Christa Landon and Karl Heinz Füssl]

1.

Most of this movement is lost. The only extant sections are a two-bar incipit of the opening of the movement, and a passage from the middle of the recapitulation to the end of the movement.

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 2

2. Menuet – Trio

Duration: 5'

Difficulty: 2
